alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:25PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, southern Benton and northern Decatur Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1125 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lexington, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Parsons, Parkers Crossroads, Darden, Bargerton, Wildersville, Busseltown, Jeannette, Rock Hill, Union Cross, Sugar Tree, Timberlake, Hinson Springs, Cozette, Parker`s Cross Roads, Warrens Bluff, I-40 Near The Tennessee River and Palestine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west Tennessee.
